ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 5 Jul 1999, Roop Dirump wrote:
>
> At this point the dervish should attack me, or maybe the paladin. Instead
> the MOB continued after the mage, who was a good distance away by now!
>
> Point of all this: If lullaby -does- nix the shit list, why did it go after
> the mage? Obviously the mage had done a great deal of damage to it, so it
> really hated him. But a nix is a nix, isn't it?

The AI is smart enough to go after an easy kill first. If
someone is almost dead, it is nearly if not entirely
impossible to pull a mob off them. I've seen lulled mobs go
after nearly dead players when they activate, despite all the
singing, healing (of the nearly dead player), and backstabbing
we're doing to it to pull it off the nearly dead player.

I'm curious how far away the mage was.

--
